**INSTITUTION
GENERAL MEDICINE
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN PROGRESS NOTE
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Jan 08 2008]
EVALUATION DATE :
**DATE[Jan 20 08]
A **AGE[in 70s]- year - old male .
Overnight events reviewed .
Medications and laboratories reviewed .
Condition stable at **INSTITUTION 10 D .
ASSESSMENT :
1. Heme .
CML - AML , non - candidate for CTX / surgery .
Pain control , supportive measures .
No opportunistic infection .
Nutritional support .
Catabolic deconditioning .
PT / OT .
2. End - stage renal disease .
HD , Monday , Wednesday , and Friday .
Volume control per HD .
Salt poor albumin p.r.n.
3. Left parotiditis .
Resolved .
4. Diabetes mellitus .
Accu-Chek , sliding scale insulin .
No diabetic foot lesions , ketoacidosis , hypoglycemia , or dehydration .
5. Coronary artery disease , cardiomyopathy , atrial fibrillation .
No chest pain or dyspnea .
S1 variable .
No audible S3 or S4 gallop .
Flow murmur stable .
MR murmur stable .
No cardiovascular decompensation , left anterior hemiblock , right bundle branch block .
Rate controlled .
6. Hypothyroidism .
Euthyroid stable .
Synthroid .
7. Hypercholesterolemia .
Stable .
No abdominal pain .
No pancreatitis .
8. GERD .
Asymptomatic .
Continue PPI .
Abdomen soft , nontender .
No nausea , vomiting , or GI bleed .
9. CVA .
Cerebellar ICH .
Cognitive function and cerebellar function stable .
Tracking commands , protective reflexes intact .
DVT , ulcer , seizure prophylaxis .
